body_html:
Sounds like this may supercede DecodeRaw?

On Wed, Dec 30, 2015 at 1:32 PM, Geoffrey Irving notifications@github.com
wrote:

bitcast would the same as numpy's unwisely named view: it would turn a
tensor of one POD dtype into any different POD type such that the last
dimension's size is compatible, without touching the bits in any way.
Specifically,

tf.bitcast(x, dtype).shape = x.shape[:-1] + [x.shape[-1] * sizeof(x.dtype) / sizeof(dtype)]

with an error if the division isn't an exact integer. The most useful cast
of bitcast is anything to uint8 or back.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#655.

Sounds like this may supercede DecodeRaw?

On Wed, Dec 30, 2015 at 1:32 PM, Geoffrey Irving notifications@github.com
wrote:

> bitcast would the same as numpy's unwisely named view: it would turn a
> tensor of one POD dtype into any different POD type such that the last
> dimension's size is compatible, without touching the bits in any way.
> Specifically,
> 
> tf.bitcast(x, dtype).shape = x.shape[:-1] + [x.shape[-1] \* sizeof(x.dtype) / sizeof(dtype)]
> 
> with an error if the division isn't an exact integer. The most useful cast
> of bitcast is anything to uint8 or back.
> 
> —

> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/655.
